laboratory_requirements.description: No laboratory, blood, or paramedical exam requirements are specified—this is a fully simplified-issue final expense model based solely on disease history and build-chart eligibility.

risk_classes.description: Royal Neighbors offers four underwriting classes for final expense products, determined by medical history, build-chart placement, and simplified issue questions.

classes.name: Preferred
criteria: Height/weight must fall within Preferred column of build chart (page 19)
No disqualifying medical conditions within last 5 years (e.g., major depression requiring hospitalization, heart attack, cancer with treatment < 5 years)
Controlled hypertension, mild asthma, or other minor conditions may be allowed

classes.name: Standard
criteria: Height/weight must fall within Standard build limits (implied by pages 18–19)
No disqualifying conditions within last 2–5 years (e.g., resolved cancer > 5 years qualifies Preferred; within 2–5 years qualifies Standard)
Age 50–85, face amount $5,000–$40,000 (up to $40,000 for ages 50–85)

classes.name: Graded Death Benefit (GDB)
criteria: Recent diagnoses or treatments (within 1–2 years) such as cancer, heart attack, or chronic diseases qualify here
Pays 30% of face in Year 1, 70% in Year 2, 100% thereafter; accidental death always 100%

classes.name: Guaranteed Issue (GI)
criteria: No medical questions—acceptance regardless of health (except age and maximum face limits)
Pays 110% of earned premiums in Years 1–2 for natural causes, 100% face in Year 3+; accidental death always 100%

tobacco_guidelines.description: Royal Neighbors differentiates Tobacco vs. Non-Tobacco primarily within Preferred and Standard classes. Guaranteed Issue bypasses medical questions entirely.

classifications.classification: Eligible for Preferred or Standard (subject to build-chart and medical history).
Routed to Standard class (Preferred is not available for tobacco users).
No tobacco questions—acceptance regardless of tobacco use, within GI age/face limits.

financial_underwriting.description: No income verification or financial multiples are required. Face amounts are limited by age and plan type (see 'Product Details' on page 4).

special_considerations.description: Additional underwriting factors include build-chart referral, ownership requirements, and accelerated/non-accelerated application options.

factors.guideline: SIWL: ages 50–85 (Standard) or 50–75 (Preferred); GDB: ages 50–85; GI: ages 50–80. Applicants outside these bands are not eligible.
Must have insurable interest; see pages 15–17 for acceptable owner/beneficiary designations (e.g., spouse, child).
Three options—e-App (instant decision, no face-to-face), Phone App (instant decision, no face-to-face), Paper App (underwriting review).
Available on SIWL and GDB (if face ≥ $7,000). Allows acceleration up to 75% of death benefit for terminal illness or nursing home confinement (page 6).
Issue ages 50–70; pays full rider face if death due to accident within 180 days; terminates at age 80 (page 7).
No additional premium; pays 1% of face (max $1,000) upon death to a designated 501(c)(3) (page 7).
Issue ages 50–85; $60/year for unlimited grandchildren (age 90 days–17 years); conversion privileges through age 24, subject to age brackets (page 8).
